alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Delaware County through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to near Delhi to near Hobart. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Delhi, Kortright, Meredith, Stamford, Hobart, Franklin, Sidney Center, East Sidney, Meridale and East Meredith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
